intro: Byttneria implacabilis, commonly known as the African wild rubber tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Malvaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which has historically been used for industrial purposes. It thrives in humid, lowland environments and is often found in secondary forests. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
